markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="">[Tanglebones](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1421)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Sometimes, when murderer buries a large number of victims in a mass grave, the vengeful spirits of the slain can become similarly tangled together. When these spirits can't untangle, they instead return to their physical remains, fusing into one horrific mass of bones and black, tar-like sludge—a tanglebones.

 One awful tale speaks of a bitter old dowager who learned that, through a legal loophole, ownership of her estate would revert to her estranged daughter. She murdered her 13 servants, buried their bodies in the house's basement, and then played the gracious mother in handing over the manor keys at the appointed time. One night, the tanglebones that arose from the dowager's atrocity murdered the daughter and her family. By the time the authorities learned of what happened, the dowager had fled the nation, changed her identity, and (the story goes) wasted no time rebuilding her fortunes—this time becoming a queen.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 28

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Tanglebones.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 7">[Tanglebones](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1421)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="CE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Undead" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=160" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Malevolence](/Sources.aspx?ID=88) pg. 71</row>

**Perception** +17; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12)

**Languages**
[Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +14, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +17, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +15

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +3

**Con** +4

**Int** -2

**Wis** +6

**Cha** +2
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 24 

**Fort** +15 

**Ref** +12 

**Will** +17 

</row>

**HP** 145
([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42))

**Immunities**
[death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyze](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38)

**Weaknesses**
bludgeoning 7

**Ectoplasmic Filament**<actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** A creature within the tanglebone's reach uses an action with the [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104) trait or a [move](/Traits.aspx?ID=114) action, or leaves a square during a move action it's using; **Effect** A filament of black, oily ectoplasm lashes out at the triggering creature, dealing 2d8+8 slashing damage (DC 25 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). If the filament deals damage, the tanglebones gains 2d8 temporary Hit Points.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +17 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d8+8 slashing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18)

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
hurled bone +17 ([Brutal](/Traits.aspx?ID=249), [range 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)),
**Damage** 2d4+8 bludgeoning

**Eerie Flexibility**   A tanglebones can shift and adjust its mass to fit into smaller areas, allowing it to fit through tight spaces as if it were a Medium creature. While [Squeezing](/Actions.aspx?ID=31), it can move at its full Speed.

**Gnaw** <actions string="Single Action" />  **Requirements** The tanglebones has [Grabbed](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) a foe; **Effect** The tanglebones gnaws and chews on the [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) target with its many skulls, dealing 2d6+8 piercing damage (DC 23 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save). On a critical failure, the creature is also [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) from the pain.

**Skeletal Storm** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The tanglebones makes a single claw Strike against every creature in reach. These attacks count toward the tanglebones' multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the tanglebones makes all its attacks.

**Sprawled Bones** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32)) Until the next time it acts, the tanglebones appears as a sprawling mass of bones. It has an automatic result of 35 on [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) checks and DCs to pass as a grisly but seemingly harmless mess.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png">Unravelers</title>

It's believed that a tanglebones's formation can be prevented if even one body in the mass grave died from a different cause than its fellows. In regions where these undead horrors are more common, additional bodies known as unravellers are often dropped into mass graves in an attempt to prevent a tanglebones from rising. 
</aside>
name: Tanglebones
